oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys - Audition (30 min) - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of a radio show audition featuring Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys, including Phil Ransom (fiddle, vocals, name unconfirmed) and Tiny (guitar, steel guitar), with announcer 'Slim Hawkins' - likely Rupert S. Dougharty, general manager of XERB (Rosarito Beach, Mexico).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Smokey Smith; Gold Coast Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Slim Hawkins) -- Theme (Gold Coast Express) -- Slim Hawkins introduces Phil Ransom [name unconfirmed] -- Alabama Jubilee (Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys) -- Slim Hawkins and Smokey Smith talk -- Steel Guitar Rag (Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys) -- Comedy routine (Slim Hawkins, Porter Rastus) -- That's How Much I Love You (Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys) -- Slim Hawkins talks to potential sponsors -- Farther Along (Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys) -- Slim Hawkins introduces Phil Ransom [name unconfirmed] -- Flop-Eared Mule (Smokey Smith and the Gold Coast Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Smith, Smokey, 1922-; Gold Coast Boys (Musical group)
